Package attomenu

Class Menu

java.lang.Object
attomenu.Menu
public class Menu
extends java.lang.Object
A simple multi-level console menu system using the Observer pattern.

Each MenuItem specifies the text for a menu entry, the Runnable object (a lambda is often preferred) to invoke when that menu entry is selected, an optional key character for selecting that MenuItem from the keyboard, and optional help text to print when requested.

Menu uses the sequential non-negative integers, the key character specified to MenuItem, or both for selecting a MenuItem using console input. If SHOW_CHAR is false, only integer keys are used. If SHOW_INT is false, only the key character is used (but if not available, an integer key will be substituted). If both are true, character keys will be used when available along with integer keys.

The Menu can be runOnce() for a single selection and response, or simply run() for many selections and responses until the user selects EXIT_CHAR ('x' by default) to exit that Menu.

Menu also provides static select(java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object[]) and <E>select(java.lang.Object,java.util.List<E>) methods for selecting one element from an array or List of objects, and a static selectFile(java.lang.Object,java.io.File,java.io.FilenameFilter) method to select a file or directory. These static select methods always use integer keys.

If HELP_CHAR is not a space, the user will be prompted to type it for help. If typed alone at a command prompt, help provided in the Menu constructor will be displayed. If followed by a space and a menu key, any help provided with that MenuItem will be displayed instead. If no help was provided for that MenuItem, then the message will be "No help available for 'key'."

Menu is philisophically similar to Swing's JMenu, using MenuItem instead of JMenuItem for the menu elements.

See the Pizza Pearl example application in package pizza for ideas.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.1
Author:
Professor George F. Rice

Gnu General Public License 3.0

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static char EXIT_CHAR
    The char command to exit the menu ('x' is default, ' ' is not permitted).
    static char HELP_CHAR
    The char command to display help ('?' is default, ' ' offers no help).
    static boolean SHOW_CHAR
    Enables character key in menus when available.
    static boolean SHOW_INT
    Enables integer key in menus (always shown if no character key is available).

    Constructs a new Menu with all menu items and associated callbacks.

  • Constructor Details

    • Menu

      public Menu​(java.lang.Object title, java.lang.Object data, java.lang.String help, MenuItem... menuItems)
      Constructs a new Menu with all menu items and associated callbacks.
      Parameters:
      title - Printed before the menu items (if not null)
      data - Printed after the menu items and before the prompt (if not null)
      help - Printed on request (if not null) to help the user
      menuItems - List of menu item text and observer / callbacks
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if EXIT_CHAR is set to a space
      Since:
      1.0

    • Menu

      Constructs a new Menu with all menu items and associated callbacks.
      Parameters:
      title - Printed before the menu items (if not null)
      data - Printed after the menu items and before the prompt (if not null)
      menuItems - List of menu item text and observer / callbacks
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if EXIT_CHAR is set to a space
      Since:
      1.0

  • Method Details

    • runOnce

      public java.lang.String runOnce()
      Displays the menu and executes the callback for one selection by the user.
      Returns:
      null if selected action succeeded, user input if an error occurred

    • run

      public void run()
      The main loop that repeatedly calls runOnce until the user enters EXIT_CHAR.

    • select

      public static <E> int select​(java.lang.Object title, java.util.List<E> list)
      Provides a menu containing all list members so the user can select one. Calls toArray on the list and passes the array to select(Object,Object[]).
      Type Parameters:
      E - The type of elements in list
      Parameters:
      title - Displayed above the menu (if not null)
      list - The List of elements to offer in the menu
      Returns:
      The index of the selected element, or -1 if no selection

    • select

      public static int select​(java.lang.Object title, java.lang.Object[] list)
      Provides a menu containing all array members so the user can select one. The menu items correspond to the index of elements. If the user enters an out of bounds index or an invalid character command, an error message is displayed followed by the prompt. If the user exits, -1 is returned to signal that the user declined to select an element.
      Parameters:
      title - Displayed above the menu (if not null)
      list - The array of elements to offer in the menu
      Returns:
      The index of the selected element, or -1 if no selection

    • selectFile

      public static java.io.File selectFile​(java.lang.Object title, java.io.File starting, java.io.FilenameFilter filter)
      Navigates the filesystem so the user can select a file or directory. The subdirectories (with a trailing '/') and files in the starting directory that match filter are listed in case-insensitive sort order along with 4 additional options: (0) .. changes to the parent directory (1) . returns a File object for the current folder (2) + prompts for a new subdirectory path, and creates and changes to it (3) ++ prompts for a new filename and returns a File object for it Otherwise, if a subdirectory is selected it is opened and the method repeats. If a file is selected it is returned. If the user enters an out of bounds index or an invalid char command, an error message is displayed followed by the prompt. If the user enters EXIT_CHAR, null is returned to signal that the user declined to select a file or directory.
      Parameters:
      title - Displayed above the menu (if not null)
      starting - The first directory to be listed, or user.home if null
      filter - A FilenameFilter object (filter hidden files if null)
      Returns:
      The selected File object, or null if no file was selected

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Formats this menu for presentation to the user.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns the hash code value for this menu.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Compares the specified object with this menu for equality.

      Returns true if and only if the specified object is also a Menu and the title, data, and all menuItems are equal and in the same order.

      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to be compared for equality with this Menu
      Returns:
      True if the specified object is equal to this Menu
